title: 2025 F1 Spanish GP schedule, India timings
description: F1 heads to the Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya for the Spanish GP this weekend (May 30-June 1). McLaren has won six of the first seven races so far this season, but Spain offers an opportunity to mix up the pecking order with a new rule change coming into force. The F2 support series will also be held alongside F1, while Formula E heads to China for the Shanghai E-Prix double-header. Here’s your complete guide for when and where to tune in from India: 2025 F1 Spanish GP schedule Lando Norris’ Monaco GP win has intensified the title battle, with just three points separating him and his McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri. So far, McLaren has clearly dominated, with Red Bull showing some bursts of pace. But the Spanish GP could be a potential turning point for the season, with the introduction of stronger tests for front wing flexing. As per the new rules, deflection allowance under static load will be reduced from 15mm to 10mm. Speaking earlier this year, Ferrari team principal Frederic Vasseur described this as a potential “gamechanger” for the competitive order. Where to watch: All F1 Spanish GP sessions will be streamed live on the Fancode and F1 TV apps. 2025 F1 Spanish GP India timingsDateDaySessionTime (IST)May 30FridayFP15pmMay 30FridayFP28:30pmMay 31SaturdayFP34pmMay 31SaturdayQualifying7:30pmJune 1SundayRace6:30pm 2025 F2 Spanish GP schedule Kush Maini made history at Monaco, becoming the first-ever Indian driver to win at the iconic street track. He followed that up with a P6 finish in the Feature Race, collecting his highest points haul of the season. This catapulted him from 17th to 12th in the championship, and more crucially, gave him a much-needed confidence boost after a difficult start to the year. “It feels like this is the start of our season, and as we head straight to Barcelona, we’ll aim to keep this momentum going as we build on these results,” said Maini. Luke Browning currently leads the standings, just three points ahead of Alexander Dunne. Where to watch: All F2 Spanish GP sessions will be streamed live on the Fancode and F1 TV apps. 2025 F2 Spanish GP India timingsDateDaySessionTime (IST)May 30FridayPractice2:35pmMay 30FridayQualifying7:25pmMay 31SaturdaySprint Race5:45pmJune 1SundayFeature Race1:30pm 2025 Formula E Shanghai E Prix schedule Shanghai will host another double-header for Formula E. The first race will feature mandatory Pit Boosts, requiring drivers to pit for a 10 percent battery recharge. Sunday’s race, however, won’t feature Pit Boost, so we should have two very different races when it comes to strategy and the overall competitive order. Nissan’s Oliver Rowland is currently dominating the championship, with a hefty 77-point lead over Porsche’s Pascal Wehrlein. Nissan also leads the way in the teams’ championship, 15 points ahead of Porsche. Indian team Mahindra Racing is third overall, 58 points behind Porsche. Where to watch: All Shanghai E-Prix sessions will be streamed live on Sony Liv. 2025 Formula E Shanghai E Prix India timingsDateDaySessionTime ISTMay 30FridayFP11:30pmMay 31SaturdayFP25:30amMay 31SaturdayQualifying 17:50amMay 31SaturdayRace 112:35pmJune 1SundayFP35:30amJune 1SundayQualifying 27:50amJune 1SundayRace 212:35pm Also see: Mahindra Racing: New Formula E car designed for performance, not cost J A Motorsport builds India’s first cross car
author: Unnatee Gidithuri
excerpt: Formula E Shanghai E-Prix and F2 Spanish GP also coming up this weekend.

html:
Formula E Shanghai E-Prix and F2 Spanish GP also coming up this weekend.

F1 heads to the Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya for the Spanish GP this weekend (May 30-June 1). McLaren has won six of the first seven races so far this season, but Spain offers an opportunity to mix up the pecking order with a new rule change coming into force.

The F2 support series will also be held alongside F1, while Formula E heads to China for the Shanghai E-Prix double-header. Here’s your complete guide for when and where to tune in from India:

2025 F1 Spanish GP schedule

Lando Norris’ Monaco GP win has intensified the title battle, with just three points separating him and his McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri. So far, McLaren has clearly dominated, with Red Bull showing some bursts of pace. But the Spanish GP could be a potential turning point for the season, with the introduction of stronger tests for front wing flexing.

As per the new rules, deflection allowance under static load will be reduced from 15mm to 10mm. Speaking earlier this year, Ferrari team principal Frederic Vasseur described this as a potential “gamechanger” for the competitive order.

Where to watch:

All F1 Spanish GP sessions will be streamed live on the Fancode and F1 TV apps.

2025 F1 Spanish GP India timings
DateDaySessionTime (IST)
May 30FridayFP15pm
May 30FridayFP28:30pm
May 31SaturdayFP34pm
May 31SaturdayQualifying7:30pm
June 1SundayRace6:30pm

2025 F2 Spanish GP schedule

Kush Maini made history at Monaco, becoming the first-ever Indian driver to win at the iconic street track. He followed that up with a P6 finish in the Feature Race, collecting his highest points haul of the season. This catapulted him from 17th to 12th in the championship, and more crucially, gave him a much-needed confidence boost after a difficult start to the year.

“It feels like this is the start of our season, and as we head straight to Barcelona, we’ll aim to keep this momentum going as we build on these results,” said Maini. Luke Browning currently leads the standings, just three points ahead of Alexander Dunne.

Where to watch:

All F2 Spanish GP sessions will be streamed live on the Fancode and F1 TV apps.

2025 F2 Spanish GP India timings
DateDaySessionTime (IST)
May 30FridayPractice2:35pm
May 30FridayQualifying7:25pm
May 31SaturdaySprint Race5:45pm
June 1SundayFeature Race1:30pm

2025 Formula E Shanghai E Prix schedule

Shanghai will host another double-header for Formula E. The first race will feature mandatory Pit Boosts, requiring drivers to pit for a 10 percent battery recharge. Sunday’s race, however, won’t feature Pit Boost, so we should have two very different races when it comes to strategy and the overall competitive order.

Nissan’s Oliver Rowland is currently dominating the championship, with a hefty 77-point lead over Porsche’s Pascal Wehrlein. Nissan also leads the way in the teams’ championship, 15 points ahead of Porsche. Indian team Mahindra Racing is third overall, 58 points behind Porsche.

Where to watch:

All Shanghai E-Prix sessions will be streamed live on Sony Liv.

2025 Formula E Shanghai E Prix India timings
DateDaySessionTime IST
May 30FridayFP11:30pm
May 31SaturdayFP25:30am
May 31SaturdayQualifying 17:50am
May 31SaturdayRace 112:35pm
June 1SundayFP35:30am
June 1SundayQualifying 27:50am
June 1SundayRace 212:35pm

J A Motorsport builds India’s first cross car
